leb.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

lex.gloss: to/for Prefix lamed: to
lex.raw: H9005	H9005 =	H9005	/ל	l	Prefix	to/for	Prefix lamed: to

lex.gloss:
to say 1) to say, speak, utter
1a) (Qal) to say, to answer, to say in one's heart, to think, to command, to promise, to intend
1b) (Niphal) to be told, to be said, to be called
1c) (Hithpael) to boast, to act proudly
1d) (Hiphil) to avow, to avouch
Aramaic equivalent: a.mar (אֲמַר "to say" H0560)
lex.raw:
H0559 H0559 = H0559 אָמַר a.mar H:V to say 1) to say, speak, utter
1a) (Qal) to say, to answer, to say in one's heart, to think, to command, to promise, to intend
1b) (Niphal) to be told, to be said, to be called
1c) (Hithpael) to boast, to act proudly
1d) (Hiphil) to avow, to avouch
Aramaic equivalent: a.mar (אֲמַר "to say" H0560)

leb.text: “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you must have a rest period, a remembrance of the trumpet blast, a holy assembly.

lex.gloss:
Holy Place This name means apartness, holiness, sacredness
Also named: hagion (ἅγιον "Holy Place" G0039)

H6944 H6944J = H6944J קֹ֫דֶשׁ qo.desh H:N-M Holy Place This name means apartness, holiness, sacredness
Also named: hagion (ἅγιον "Holy Place" G0039)

leb.text: You must not do any regular work, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.’”

nirv.text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘On the first day of the seventh month you must have a day of rest. It must be a special service that is announced with trumpet blasts.

Also named: hagion (ἅγιον "Holy Place" G0039)

nirv.text: Do not do any regular work on that day. Instead, bring an offering that is made to me with fire.’”

leb.text: After they listened to the king, they went out, and behold, the star which they had seen at its rising led them until it came and stood above the place where the child was.

lex.gloss:
child παιδίον, -ου, τό dimin, of παῖς,
[in LXX chiefly for יֶלֶד, also for נַעַר, בֵּן, etc., frequently in To in ref. to full-grown youth ;]
a young child, a little one: Mat.2:8-9, 11, ff., Luk.1:59, 66 1:76, 80 2:17, 27 2:40, Jhn.16:21, Heb.11:23; of older children, Mat.18:2, 4-5, Mrk.5:39-41 7:30 9:24, 36, Luk.9:47-48 18:17, Jhn.4:49; in pl., Mat.11:16 14:21 15:38 18:3 19:13-14, Mrk.7:28 10:13 ff., Luk.7:32 11:7 18:16, Heb.2:13-14 Metaphorical, 1Co.14:20. Colloq. in familiar address (as Eng. colloq., "lads "-see M, Pr., 170n and Irish use of "boys"): Jhn.21:5, 1Jn.2:13 Jn 2:18 Jn 3:7 †
SYN.: see: παῖς (AS)

leb.text: Now when they saw the star, they rejoiced with very great joy.

lex.gloss:
very σφόδρα adv. (prop. neut. of σφοδρός, excessive, violent)
[in LXX chiefly for מְאֹד ;]
very, very much, exceedingly: with verbs, Mat.17:6, 23 18:31 19:25 26:22 27:54, Act.6:7; with adjectives, Mat.2:10, Mrk.16:4, Luk.18:23, Rev.16:21.†
(AS)

leb.text: And when they came into the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him. And opening their treasure boxes, they offered him gifts of gold and frankincense and myrrh.

lex.gloss:
myrrh σμύρνα
(in some MSS, ζμ-; see Bl., § 3, 9), -ης, ἡ, [in LXX for מֹר ;]
myrrh, a resinous gum used as an unguent and for em­balming: Mat.2:11, Jhn.19:39.†
(AS)

nirv.text: After the Wise Men had listened to the king, they went on their way. The star they had seen when they were in the east went ahead of them. It finally stopped over the place where the child was.

lex.gloss:
child παιδίον, -ου, τό dimin, of παῖς,

nirv.text: The Wise Men went to the house. There they saw the child with his mother Mary. They bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures. They gave him gold, incense and myrrh.

lex.gloss:
myrrh σμύρνα
(in some MSS, ζμ-; see Bl., § 3, 9), -ης, ἡ, [in LXX for מֹר ;]
myrrh, a resinous gum used as an unguent and for em­balming: Mat.2:11, Jhn.19:39.†
(AS)

myrrh σμύρνα
(in some MSS, ζμ-; see Bl., § 3, 9), -ης, ἡ, [in LXX for מֹר ;]
myrrh, a resinous gum used as an unguent and for em­balming: Mat.2:11, Jhn.19:39.†
(AS)
